0.Pros: Good work environment, Bi-annual bonuses, good benefits, 401k, company parties
0.Cons: advancement, minimal raises, old building, small office space, low number of employees

1.Pros: Flexible hours, steady pay, great starting job
1.Cons: Rude customers, poor pay, very stressful

2.Pros: McDonalds can be a good way to build career skills. As well it has it fun moments. Free meals for management.
2.Cons: Customers can be really rude. Employees can be difficult to deal with or train. Insurance isn't that good.

3.Pros: Easy job to obtain. Mostly flexible hours. Discount on foods. Can find a McDonald's anywhere across the US to work in. Little problem solving required.
3.Cons: Manual labor. Not the greatest experience to add to a resume for entry level professional positions. Only two actual promotion positions available.

4.Pros: Loved it to be honest this isn't such a bad place to learn how a business is run and the basics of management and teamwork.
4.Cons: Just the overall quality of the product being sold - it isn't high end food! And it can be a bit gross.

5.Pros: Easy work, fast money, good friends
5.Cons: Horrible pay, hard to move up

6.Pros: Received customer service experience and multi-tasking
6.Cons: Rude customers, work too hard for what you are getting paid for.

7.Pros: Quick Paced, very friendly, team environment, easy, our number one goal is to make every customer leave with a smile.
7.Cons: Co workers are often mad or in a bad mood because they are working a at McDonald's. Also the managers won't let you get training to further your career.

8.Pros: A lot of hours free food
8.Cons: Can be cut if they don't need you to work

9.Pros: Nothing. Nada. Not a single thing. Your early morning elderly customers have conversations about how Obama needs to "go back to Africa." I hope their families dump them in a nursing home and never look back. : )
9.Cons: Worst kind of customer service job. I hope my "managers" stay there and rot : ) In the end I chose to work this job to make a little extra money. Life is all about choices. I recommend no one choose to work here.
